attributes.title: Purify Yourself Through Intense Action
attributes.description:
In (24th June 2012) morning's talk on Bhagavad Gita, Chapter 5, Verse 7, Paramahamsa Nithyananda (Swamiji) explains how intense action provides an avenue to enlightenment. When we engage in intense action, which silences the mind and stimulates the body, we are purified of our negative beliefs and memories. Many of us fear that our willingness to be intensely active causes us to be taken advantage of. If we agree to work, we may be exploited. But Bhagawan Sri Krishna has no need to take advantage of anyone. Paramahamsa reassures us that Krishna's instruction to commit ourselves to intense action is for our benefit. The action purifies us and sets us free from fear and laziness. Having passed over these great hurdles, we approach the state of living enlightenment.

Bhagavad Gita (Song of God) is a timeless treatise on the essence of living enlightenment. The Gita was imparted by the enlightened Hindu incarnation Sri Krishna to the warrior-prince Arjuna over 5000 years ago. Amazingly, the spiritual wisdom and life solutions offered in the Gita are so universal and current that even today it is used as a personal transformation guide.
